title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement mhk.hesselbarth@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: outlines propose change suppoRt. several ways can contribute project. want know contribute open source projects like one, see Open Source Guide.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: Please note suppoRt project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: Browse documentation see can find solution. Still stuck? Open issue GitHub GitHub. ‚Äôll try best address , questions often lead better documentation discovery bugs. Want ask question private? Contact package maintainer mhk.hesselbarth<>gmail.com. Please try include reproducible example using example reprex package.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: Take look documentation issue GitHub list see isn‚Äôt included suggested yet. , please open new issue! can‚Äôt promise implement idea, helps : Explain detail work. Keep scope narrow possible.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: Report issue GitHub can fix . good bug report makes easier us , please include: content utils::sessionInfo(). details local setup might helpful troubleshooting. Detailed steps reproduce bug , please try include reproducible example using example reprex package.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: Good documentation makes difference, help improve welcome! use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation.

title: Contributing to suppoRt
text: try follow GitHub flow development. Fork repo clone computer. learn process, see guide. Don‚Äôt forget pull new changes starting work! Open RStudio project file (.Rproj) install development dependencies (e.g., using devtools::install_dev_deps()). Make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). Create new Git branch use name briefly describes proposed changes. Make changes: Write code. Test code (bonus points adding unit tests using testthat package). Document code (see function documentation ). Check code devtools::check() aim 0 errors, warnings notes. Commit push changes. Submit pull request. New code follow tidyverse style guide.

text: install suppoRt, please use:

title: Collection of support functions
text: Please note suppoRt package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms. contribute project, please see Contributing guidelines.

title: all_real ‚Äî all_real
text: real

title: all_real ‚Äî all_real
text: x vector. include_na Logical `NA` also considered non-real. verbose Logical number non-real numbers printed message.

title: all_real ‚Äî all_real
text: vector

title: all_real ‚Äî all_real
text: function checks vector contains NaN Inf values. Input must vector. include_na = TRUE also NA values considered.

title: all_real ‚Äî all_real
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3, NA, 5, NaN, Inf) all_real(x) #> > Includes 2 non-real values #> [1] FALSE  y <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) all_real(y) #> > Includes 0 non-real values #> [1] TRUE

text: vector

text: function checks vector contains NaN Inf values. Input must vector. include_na = TRUE also NA values considered.

title: any_real ‚Äî any_real
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3, NA, 5, NaN, Inf) any_real(x) #> > Includes 2 non-real values #> [1] TRUE  y <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) any_real(y) #> > Includes 0 non-real values #> [1] TRUE

title: is_real ‚Äî is_real
text: real

title: is_real ‚Äî is_real
text: x vector. include_na Logical `NA` also considered non-real. verbose Logical number non-real numbers printed message.

title: is_real ‚Äî is_real
text: vector

title: is_real ‚Äî is_real
text: function checks vector contains real numbers returns FALSE NaN Inf values. Input must vector. include_na = TRUE also NA values considered.

title: is_real ‚Äî is_real
code: x <- c(1, 2, 3, NA, 5, NaN, Inf) is_real(x) #> > Includes 2 non-real values #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE is_real(x, include_na = TRUE) #> > Includes 3 non-real values #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  y <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7) is_real(y) #> > Includes 0 non-real values #> [1] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
text: Replace infinite

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
code: replace_infinite(x, what = c("NaN", "Inf"), value = c(NA, NA), verbose = TRUE)

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
text: x vector. infinite values replaced. See details. value Value used replace selected infinite values. verbose Print warning messages.

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
text: vector

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
text: function converts NaN Inf values NA. Input must vector. Can either = c("NaN", "Inf") replace NaN Inf just one two, e.g. = "NaN".

title: replace_infinite ‚Äî replace_infinite
code: vec <- c(1, 2, 3, NA, 5, NaN, Inf) replace_infinite(vec) #> [1]  1  2  3 NA  5 NA NA replace_infinite(vec, what = "NaN", value = NA) #> [1]   1   2   3  NA   5  NA Inf replace_infinite(vec, value = c(NA, 0)) #> [1]  1  2  3 NA  5 NA  0

code: save_ggplot(   plot,   filename = NULL,   path = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: save_ggplot ‚Äî save_ggplot
text: plot Plot save. filename File name create disk. device (e.g. jpeg) must specified file extension. path Path save plot (combined filename). overwrite true, existing file overwritten. verbose true, messages printed console. ... Options passed ggsave.

title: save_ggplot ‚Äî save_ggplot
text: function checks plot aready exists saving . file aready exists overwrite = FALSE (default), file saved. filename path combined using file.path(). See ?ggplot2::ggsave() information. possible set path = "" use entire path including file name filename argument.

title: save_ggplot ‚Äî save_ggplot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ x <- runif(n = 100) y <- runif(n = 100) result_plot <- ggplot2::ggplot() + ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) save_ggplot(result_plot, filename = "result_ggpplot.jpeg") } # }

title: save_rds ‚Äî save_rds
text: function checks file aready exists saving . file aready exists overwrite = FALSE (default), file saved. filename path combined using file.path(). See ?base::saveRDS() information. possible set path = "" use entire path including file name filename argument.
